content:
Point4D Struct

Definition

Represents an x-, y-, z-, and w-coordinate point in world space used in performing transformations with non-affine 3-D matrices.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4DConverter))]
[System.Windows.Markup.ValueSerializer(typeof(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Converters.Point4DValueSerializer))]
public struct Point4D : IFormattable
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
Point4D

Remarks

In XAML, the delimiter between the values of a Point4D can be either a comma or a space.

Some cultures might use the comma character as the decimal delimiter instead of the period character. XAML processing for invariant culture defaults to en-US in most XAML processor implementations, and expects the period to be the decimal delimiter. You should avoid using the comma character as the decimal delimiter if specifying a Point4D in XAML, because that will clash with the string type conversion of a Point4D attribute value into its components.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="x,y,z,w"/>  
-or-  
<object property="x y z w"/>

XAML Values

x
The X component of this Point4D structure.

y
The Y component of this Point4D structure.

z
The Z component of this Point4D structure.

w
The W component of this Point4D structure.

Constructors

Point4D(Double,Double,Double,Double)

Initializes a new instance of a Point4D structure.

public Point4D (double x, double y, double z, double w);
x
Double

The x-coordinate of the new Point4D structure.

y
Double

The y-coordinate of the new Point4D structure.

z
Double

The z-coordinate of the new Point4D structure.

w
Double

The w-coordinate of the new Point4D structure.

Properties

W

Gets or sets the W component of this Point4D structure.

public double W { get; set; }
Value
Double

The W component of this Point4D structure. The default value is 0.

X

Gets or sets the X component of this Point4D structure.

public double X { get; set; }
Value
Double

The X component of this Point4D structure. The default value is 0.

Y

Gets or sets the Y component of this Point4D structure.

public double Y { get; set; }
Value
Double

The Y component of this Point4D structure. The default value is 0.

Z

Gets or sets the Z component of this Point4D structure.

public double Z { get; set; }
Value
Double

The Z component of this Point4D structure. The default value is 0.

Methods

Add(Point4D,Point4D)

Adds a Point4D structure to a Point4D.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D Add (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point2);
point1
Point4D

The first Point4D structure to add.

point2
Point4D

The second Point4D structure to add.

Returns
Point4D

Returns the sum of point1 and point2.

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified Object is a Point4D structure and if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W* properties of the specified Object are equal to the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W* properties of this Point4D structure.

public override bool Equals (object o);
o
Object

The object to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if instances are equal; otherwise, false.

true if o (the passed Object) is a Point4D structure and is identical with this Point4D structure; false otherwise.

Remarks

If o (the passed object) is not a Point4D structure, this method returns false.

Because a Double value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Point4D values that are logically equal might fail.

Equals(Point4D)

Compares two Point4D structures for equality.

public bool Equals (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D value);
value
Point4D

The instance of Point4D to compare to this instance.

Returns
Boolean

true if instances are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Because a Double value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Point4D values that are logically equal might fail.

Equals(Point4D,Point4D)

Compares two Point4D structures for equality.

public static bool Equals (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point2);
point1
Point4D

The first Point4D structure to compare.

point2
Point4D

The second Point4D structure to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z* components of point3D1 and point3D2 are equal; false otherwise.

Remarks

Two Point4D structures are equal if the values of their X, Y, Z, and W properties are the same.

Because Double values can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Point4D instances that are logically equal might fail.

GetHashCode()

Returns a hash code for this Point4D structure.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

Returns a hash code for this Point4D structure.

Multiply(Point4D,Matrix3D)

Transforms the specified Point4D structure by the specified Matrix3D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D Multiply (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D matrix);
point
Point4D

The Point4D structure to transform.

matrix
Matrix3D

The transformation Matrix3D structure.

Returns
Point4D

Returns the result of transforming point and matrix.

Offset(Double,Double,Double,Double)

Translates the Point4D structure by the specified amounts.

public void Offset (double deltaX, double deltaY, double deltaZ, double deltaW);
deltaX
Double

The amount to offset the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X* coordinate of this Point4D structure.

deltaY
Double

The amount to offset the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y* coordinate of this Point4D structure.

deltaZ
Double

The amount to offset the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z* coordinate of this Point4D structure.

deltaW
Double

The amount to offset the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W* coordinate of this Point4D structure.

Remarks

Note that calling the Offset method will only have an effect if you can change the W, X, Y, and Z properties directly. Because Point4D is a value type, if you reference a Point4D object by using a property or indexer, you get a copy of the object, not a reference to the object. If you attempt to change W, X, Y, or Z on a property or indexer reference, a compiler error occurs. Similarly, calling Offset on the property or indexer will not change the underlying object. If you want to change the value of a Point4D that is referenced as a property or indexer, create a new Point4D, modify its fields, and then assign the Point4D back to the property or indexer.

Parse(String)

Converts a String representation of a point4D structure into the equivalent Point4D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D Parse (string source);
source
String

The String representation of the point4D structure.

Returns
Point4D

Returns the equivalent Point4D structure.

Subtract(Point4D,Point4D)

Subtracts a Point4D structure from a Point4D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D Subtract (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point2);
point1
Point4D

The Point4D structure to be subtracted from.

point2
Point4D

The Point4D structure to subtract from point1.

Returns
Point4D

Returns the difference between point1 and point2.

ToString()

Creates a String representation of this Point4D structure.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

Returns a String containing the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W* values of this Point4D structure.

ToString(IFormatProvider)

Creates a String representation of this Point4D structure.

public string ToString (IFormatProvider provider);
provider
IFormatProvider

Culture-specific formatting information.

Returns
String

Returns a String containing the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W* values of this Point4D structure.

Operators

op_Addition(Point4D,Point4D)

Adds a Point4D structure to a Point4D.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D op_Addition (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point2);
point1
Point4D

The first Point4D structure to add.

point2
Point4D

The second Point4D structure to add.

Returns
Point4D

Returns the sum of point1 and point2.

op_Equality(Point4D,Point4D)

Compares two Point4D structures for equality.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point2);
point1
Point4D

The first Point4D structure to compare.

point2
Point4D

The second Point4D structure to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z* coordinates of point4D1 and point4D2 are equal; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two Point4D structures are equal if the values of their X, Y, Z, and W properties are the same.

Because a Double value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Point4D values that are logically equal might fail.

op_Inequality(Point4D,Point4D)

Compares two Point4D structures for inequality.

public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point2);
point1
Point4D

The first Point4D structure to compare.

point2
Point4D

The second Point4D structure to compare.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.X*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Y*, stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.Z*, and stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D.W* coordinates of point4D1 and point4D2 are different; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Two Point4D structures are not equal if the values of their X, Y, Z, and W properties are different.

Because a Double value can lose precision when arithmetic operations are performed on them, a comparison between two Point4D values that are logically equal might fail.

op_Multiply(Point4D,Matrix3D)

Transforms the specified Point4D structure by the specified Matrix3D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D op_Multiply (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D matrix);
point
Point4D

The Point4D structure to transform.

matrix
Matrix3D

The transformation Matrix3D structure.

Returns
Point4D

Returns the result of transforming point and matrix.

op_Subtraction(Point4D,Point4D)

Subtracts a Point4D structure from a Point4D structure and returns the result as a Point4D structure.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D op_Subtraction (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point1, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point2);
point1
Point4D

The Point4D structure to be subtracted from.

point2
Point4D

The Point4D structure to subtract from point1.

Returns
Point4D

Returns the difference between point1 and point2.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IFormattable.ToString(String,IFormatProvider)

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. For a description of this member, see stem.IFormattable.ToString*.

string IFormattable.ToString (string format, IFormatProvider provider);
format
String

The string specifying the format to use.

-or-

null to use the default format defined for the type of the IFormattable implementation.

provider
IFormatProvider

The IFormatProvider to use to format the value.

-or-

null to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.

Returns
String

A string containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
